solution_line_template: The first group uses a total of {students_group1} students * {markers_per_student_group1} markers = <<{students_group1}*{markers_per_student_group1}={markers_used_group1}>>{markers_used_group1} markers.

The second group uses a total of {students_group2} students * {markers_per_student_group2} markers = <<{students_group2}*{markers_per_student_group2}={markers_used_group2}>>{markers_used_group2} markers.
This is a total of {markers_used_group1} + {markers_used_group2} = <<{markers_used_group1}+{markers_used_group2}={total_markers_used_groups1_2}>>{total_markers_used_groups1_2} markers.
The total number of markers in the boxes is {markers_per_box} markers * {num_boxes} boxes = <<{markers_per_box}*{num_boxes}={total_markers_available}>>{total_markers_available} markers.

This leaves {total_markers_available} - {total_markers_used_groups1_2} = <<{total_markers_available}-{total_markers_used_groups1_2}={remaining_markers_for_last_group}>>{remaining_markers_for_last_group} markers for the last group to split between themselves.

The last group is made up of {total_students} total students - {students_group1} students in the first group - {students_group2} students in the second group = <<{total_students}-{students_group1}-{students_group2}={students_in_last_group}>>{students_in_last_group} students.

Therefore, students in the last group receive {remaining_markers_for_last_group} markers / {students_in_last_group} students = <<{remaining_markers_for_last_group}/{students_in_last_group}={markers_per_student_last_group}>>{markers_per_student_last_group} markers each.
